meanings.definition: To counterbalance or compensate for something
meanings.sent1: She tried to offset her carbon footprint by planting trees.
meanings.sent2: Eating a healthy breakfast can help offset the effects of a late night.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to offset its weight by sitting on the other side of the scale.
meanings.sent4: His kindness offset the harsh words spoken by his colleague.
meanings.sent5: The extra exercise offset the indulgent dessert she had.

meanings.definition: A position or value that is used as a starting point for comparison
meanings.sent1: The teacher used the average score as an offset for grading the tests.
meanings.sent2: The zero point on the ruler serves as the offset for measuring length.
meanings.sent3: The offset on the map helped them locate the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The old building served as an offset for the new skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The offset in the equation helped solve the math problem.

meanings.definition: A printing technique where ink is transferred from a plate to a rubber blanket before being printed on paper
meanings.sent1: The offset in the printing process ensures a clear image on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The magazine used offset printing for high-quality images.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student accidentally spilled ink on the offset.
meanings.sent4: The offset technique revolutionized the speed of printing newspapers.
meanings.sent5: The artist preferred offset for its precise color reproduction.
